item.title: UN report: Thousands of Palestinians detained, tortured, and killed in Israeli custody

item.title: Germany: Alcohol-free beer sales double in past decade
item.description: Germany's non-alcoholic beer production has doubled in ten years, reaching 556 million liters in 2023, according to a Destatis report. Sales of low-alcohol drinks like Radler also rose. Despite the trends, alcoholic beer remains dominant. Breweries are challenged by inflation, with a notable increase in beer prices from 2022 to 2023.

item.title: Dazzling Auroras possible as geomagnetic storms likely to hit earth
item.description: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hawk Tuah' girl Hailey Welch debuts on X, calls Elon Musk her 'hero'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ground cinnamon recalled in US due to elevated levels of lead
item.description: Federal health authorities have urged consumers to check their spice racks for ground cinnamon products due to elevated lead levels. The FDA recommended recalls for nine brands, warning prolonged exposure could cause serious health issues. Several companies, including American Spices and Advance Food International, have issued recalls for affected products. Consumers are advised to seek refunds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mysterious fireball streaks across sky, stuns observers in western US
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Megan Thee Stallion campaigns for Kamala Harris, performs 'Girls in the Hood' and 'Savage'
item.description: Megan Thee Stallion performed at Kamala Harris' campaign event at Georgia State University in Atlanta, with the rally drawing around 10,000 attendees. The event featured performances by Megan Thee Stallion and Quavo, and Harris focused on key issues including price gouging and immigration. Harris' campaign has raised $200 million and gathered significant volunteer support ahead of the election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief killed in Iran?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh assassinated in Iran
item.description: Ismail Haniyeh, Hamas chief, was killed in an attack on his residence in Tehran, as announced by both Hamas and Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. Haniyeh was in Tehran for President Masoud Pezeshkian's swearing-in. The IRGC is investigating the incident. "The cause is under investigation and will be announced soon," it added.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'Indecent': Macron's awkward embrace with sports minister at Paris Olympics raises eyebrows
item.description: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hundreds of China merchants join protest against Temu
item.description: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.

item.title: Why this Brazilian Olympic surfer's pose has gone viral
item.description: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris to hold first rally with VP pick in crucial Philadelphia, say sources
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris unveils $50m 'Fearless' ad campaign, targeting Trump
item.description: US vice president Kamala Harris launched a $50 million ad campaign with a one-minute spot titled “Fearless” after consolidating support post-Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. The campaign targets key battleground states and young voters, focusing on Donald Trump's felony convictions and anti-abortion measures, aiming to close the polling gap with her rival.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris's 'weird' campaign strategy: How Democrats are trying to make Trump laughingstock
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'White dudes for Harris' raise over $4 million, discuss women's rights
item.description: A live video call urging white men to support Kamala Harris raised $4 million with over 190,000 participants, featuring celebrities like Mark Hamill and Josh Groban. Organized by Ross Morales Rocketto of 'Run for Something,' the event focused on the importance of white male votes in the upcoming election against Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
